name: Hilton Brighton Metropole

reviews.text: We stayed in Brighton Hilton Metropole over the Easter weekend, as a family of four.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Brighton!

reviews.text: The hotel is positioned on the seafront, a 5-10min lovely walk along to the Pier, Lanes etc.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel which can be a real bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has recently undergone a sympathetic refurbishment, and the results are stunning.
reviews.title: Great Weekend - not as bad as others have said

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual with Hilton Hotels, all the staff are friendly and professional, a result of being well-trained.
reviews.title: Lovely sea view room - disappointing leisure facilities

reviews.text: Our only gripe was that our family room was booked for 4, but everything was set out for only 3 - including beds, towels, glasses, toiletries - just a niggle, but disappointing all the same as it showed a lack of attention to detail.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, But Overpriced Compared to Others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my Boyfriend away for a weekend of romance to Brighton and stayed at the hotel, now from the pictures, the basic room looked ok to me. When we got there, it was in a great central location (nect tothe old pier) the outside was pretty, the reception was magnificent and even so was our landing and the use of of all the facilties like the pool and sauna was great. But our room wasnt. It was small, dark and with the bed they had tried to make it so morden (attched to the wall and only two legs to support it) was so hard. i couldnt wait to go home. Its a lovely hotel, all i would say is upgrasde to a better room.
reviews.title: UPPGRADE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a Double Hilton Deluxe room. This was described as spacious but was very small with a small bathroom with a shower but no bath. Room had a double bed, minibar and a desk/dressing table area and one small wheeled chair. The room number was 620. However, it was a pleasant room with a seaview through two windows. Well equiped, normal Hilton standard. Left windows open to hear the sound of the sea (we are not disturbed by city noise, which is there as the hotel is on the main sea front road).
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was fine. Efficient egg station for fresh eggs and pancakes. Service at the table varied on the two days we were there; staff were keen to help but seemed new and not yet fully trained to deal with a breakfast rush. The main dining room is very nice but overflows into a function room, which looked a very dull place to eat.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar lacks atmosphere.
reviews.title: Staff were friendly, but we arrived earlier than expected and was given a very small room which we had to change.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Swimming pool was good and large enough that a couple of kids do not block swimming. Sauna is small.
reviews.title: Overpriced, tatty rooms but great location

reviews.text: I stayed here in February for 20 nights for Business. The room i was given was nice and big with an extra pull out sofabed, which came in handy when my family visited me. The room was clean and quiet and the internet connection was good but unfortunately not wireless, it also had a large Plasma tv. The fitness and pool was fine and not crowded. There was a huge Breakfast Buffet with everything You want and the quality was very good. The Bar was big and the prices where ok for this area/location, however the service in the bar could be very slow - but still friendly. Finally i most of all enjoyed the friendly and helpfull staff, from Reception, Housekeeping, Concierge, Restaurant, Bar and Management. I will defenetaly go back here in the Summer sometime for relaxing with my Family. Thanks from J.O.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with VERY friendly Staff

reviews.text: We booked three rooms for a family party and found it a bit disappointing for the price; our balcony doors and bathroom door locks were broken - when the repair man came up he said 'they all need replacing here'. The queues for check-in are long and slow and not all the stations were open, even at the peak of checking-in time. My parents were shown to the wrong room and the staff insisted it was right even though it had no sea view and was not by any means 'deluxe'. There were a lot of hen parties staying so it was a bit noisy later on. The rooms were fine and clean but the decor is tired. I'm sure you could get a far nicer posh b&b for the same money. The buffet breakfast is legendary and vast which helped plus it's in a great seafront location.
reviews.title: Pretty tatty for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Brighton Metropole on Saturday night before the Sussex Beacons Half Marathon. Had a deluxe room with breakfast included, used the Hilton half price deal so got it at a great price. Needed to check out a little late so i could have a shower after the half marathon. I only needed an extra hour which they gave to me free which was a great help. Check in was good and room was very good size. Shower good and done the trick. Breakfast in the morning was also vey good and found it had a nice selection. Previous reviews made me a bit concerned, however i thought hotel and price paid was great.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Service

reviews.text: We booked a two night stay here for a family half term treat. We got a special deal £63 per night. We weren't expecting much given some of the reviews. When we arrived, we were given keys for a room which was already occupied! We complained and were given a much smaller room which only slept 3- we totalled 4. Reception said they would send up another bed but I complained and we given a deluxe suite- much to my children's delight!
reviews.title: Value for money and an enjoyable weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our breakfasts and use of the pool. I hoped to book a indian head massage on Saturday ( my birthday) but they were fully booked.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location - don't let bad reviews put you off!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week we stayed in the Hilton for 2 nights on a bed and breakfast basis in a sea view room. (This was a gift from our son.) The hotel is in a good location on the sea front and the hotel, itself, had an elegant feel about it. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and well decorated. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower cubicle with a good selection of, what looked and felt like, good quality toiletries.
reviews.title: Worst afternoon tea ever.

reviews.text: We thought the breakfast was excellent – so much choice. (We can especially recommend the pork and leek sausages!) We loved the decor of the main breakfast room. On our second morning this was full and we have to go in to the ‘overflow’ breakfast room next door. We didn’t think that was as nice. It seemed a darker room as there was no natural light. (I think the windows may have been covered over with curtains.)
reviews.title: Getting better, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of minor criticisms – the air conditioning in our room sounded very noisy and also the woodwork in the corridor on our floor (4) looked in need of a touch up as it was chipped in places.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended.
reviews.title: Not your average Hilton

reviews.text: The Europen staff at the hotel are great lovely serivce and very helpful.......the English staff are terrible. No amount of excuses makes up for poor service, rudeness and laziness.
reviews.title: Like travelling on British Rail

reviews.text: This Hilton chain should be ashamed of this hotel.
reviews.title: Dreadful

reviews.text: In time of recession employees should be greatful they have jobs!!!!
reviews.title: Seaside fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel a lot, and maybe stay in a dozen or so hotels each year. The last time I stayed in a hotel as bad as this was about 3 years ago and was in an obscure town in Egypt. The hotel does have a good location, right on the seafront, but there's not a whole lot else I can say in its favour.
reviews.title: Grand luxury on the seafront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom they originally tried to give me was hideous. It was badly in need of a new coat of paint, and the bathroom had tiles missing from the walls. I phoned their "1 call" button on the phone (supposedly any service you could possibly require all from pressing one button) to ask for a new room. No-one answered, so I had to traipse back downstairs with my luggage to reception.
reviews.title: Do not accept room 412!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a double room on 5th floor. The room was filthy with the bottom of the curtains black from dirt. Large stains on the carpet, air con didn't work and was held onto the ceiling with sellotape, square sink in round hole, broken bed, wardrobe with sliding doors and no runners etc etc. Have emailed to register concerns - especially the blocked shower head which is a prime cause of Legionella but had no response.
reviews.title: Dreadful hotel - not worthy of 2 stars!!

reviews.text: I have stayed at the metrople (on business where I do not have a choice) many, many times. This particular occasion, I got a 'rabbit-hutch' as a room (I was on my own) but previously I have had a juinor suite as normal rooms were full. Also the hotel has refurbished a lot of the rooms, alas not my little rabbit-hutch though ! The refurbished rooms are truly very nice and in keeping for this 4* hotel. My rabbit-hutch is not though. My view: scaffolding outside. Although I did not pay for this room, it is embarrassingly over-priced for what it is.
reviews.title: This depends on your room !

reviews.text: The restaurant was excellent and a hugh variety of breakfast, also excellent servce from both the reception and restaurant.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, if you do stay there (and everything else is fine), ensure you get a decent refurbished room..
reviews.title: Would recommend if staying in Brighton

reviews.text: Well we booked this 4 weeks before arriving (9/10th Aug 12) on LastMinute.com. Looking for B&B for 2 nights. This came up the cheapest at £99 per room per night for (2 adults and 1 child) including B&B. The hotel itself is fantastic, as you would expect, our rooms were large, spacious and clean. Breakfast was in the most amazing room. Breakfast was HOT and plentyful of any type of breakfast you could think of. Great leisure Centre and indoor heated pool. Located almost opposite the Old Brighton Pier which burnt down and only 5 minutes walk to The Lanes (where the shops, bars and places to eat are). Whilst at The lanes, check out Donatello's Italian restaurant, cheap and food amazing, atmosphere fantastic.
reviews.title: Tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a large grand building but really not up to 4 *standards these days. The public areas are great, but the rooms are really tired and you will find better in the smaller 3* hotels that are on the seafront.
reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be

reviews.text: First room had no aircon and the windows would not open. Musty smell was due to a wet carpet. We were moved to another room but the bathroom had really seen better days and the kettle had to be boiled on the floor as the proper socket did not work!
reviews.title: The only place we ever book in Brighton

reviews.text: Not worth the money these days...come on Hilton get your act together...there is competition in Brighton!!
reviews.title: Should not be allowed to call themselves a Hilton

reviews.text: We have just had another break at the Metropole and this time stayed for four nights. On booking in I initially disliked the room allocation and the ever helpful staff immediately moved us. This took some juggling but at no point was it an issue.
reviews.title: Large group for 40th birthday

reviews.text: Breakfast was busy as there was a bridge seminar going on but out large family group were found a table on every morning. We didn't have to wait once.
reviews.title: In need of a makeover

reviews.text: Where to start...small room even for a single, no air conditioning, very basic. Service in the main restaurant was terrible, because I was on my own I've been told one night that they didn't have tables but I could see a lot of table free. They don't obviously like to give table to one person in the main restaurant because even when I arrived I've been told at reception that I was better off in the bar where they serve food.
reviews.title: Worst Hilton I stayed

reviews.text: The service in the bar was very slow, when I left I could hear people complaining for the same reasons, far too expensive for what you get. I've been in Hllton hotels before and never experienced something so bad
reviews.title: Great sleep, good location

reviews.text: Spent a weekend at the Hilton Metropole as it was the only hotel that would let us have 3 people in a room and would allow us to book for only one night (most have a 2-3 night minimum over summer). We had an amazing sleep due to the very comfortable beds, quiet rooms and blackout curtains. Our room was very large and well equipped. The hotel was in a good location for walking around Brighton. We arrived by train and it was a 10-15 min walk from the station. The reception staff were courteous. We did not eat in the Hotel as there are many good restaurants and cafes nearby. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value for short stay

reviews.text: Booked a short, lastminute stay at a reasonable price at this traditional style hotel located on the beach front. Reception staff were exceptionally helpful - although I got the impression the computer systems they used weren't necessarily aiding them that much - in getting us an ideal room. The room itself was very spacious with a large ensuite bathroom. The spa facilities generally compare favourably with other hotels I have stayed in, although the sauna was quite small, but then I was always the only one in there. Although I never used it the gym looked pretty well equipped.
reviews.title: Family Discriminatory Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff always appeared helpful and friendly. The breakfast was generally very good apart from firstly the egg situation - no choice except scrambled - and no staff present in "cook to order" station; and secondly the tea which was just terrible! (Use a decent tea brand, please.)
reviews.title: Worth a try

description: Explore vibrant Brighton from the beachfront Hilton Brighton Metropole hotel, the South of England's largest residential conference centre. Pamper yourself in The Metropole Spa, swim laps in the heated indoor pool, relax in the sauna or work out in the gym. Explore Brighton attractions like the Royal Pavilion and The Lanes shopping area or visit the city’s vast array of bars, restaurants and nightclubs.Enjoy sea views as you savour à la carte dining in the Windsor Restaurant or unwind with a cocktail or light meal on the sun terrace of the Metropole Bar & Lounge. Host an event in one of 28 meeting rooms and 9 exhibition halls, most with wireless internet access. The hotel is conveniently located just 30 minutes from London Gatwick Airport, and less than an hour by train from Central London, making it the ideal choice for international conferences and events. From Hilton Guest Rooms to Suites, all rooms at the Hilton Brighton Metropole hotel have high-speed internet access. Step up to a Deluxe Room or Suite for extra space.
